TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national , who was born in DATE and lives in PERSON .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the applicant , may be summarised as follows .
On DATE the applicant married . On CARDINAL DATE his wife gave birth to a boy . In accordance with Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW , the applicant was presumed to be the child ’s father .
In DATE the applicant ’s wife moved to a different place together with the child .

On DATE the Banská Bystrica District Court granted the request of the applicant ’s wife that she be granted the custody of the child . It further ordered the applicant to contribute to the child ’s maintenance . On DATE the ORG upheld ORG judgment .

Subsequently the applicant claimed that the marriage be dissolved . In his action he alleged , inter alia , that he had had sexual intercourse with his wife in DATE for the last time , and that they had not lived in a common household since DATE . The applicant further requested that the child be placed in his custody .
On DATE ORG granted the divorce of the applicant and of his wife . The child was placed in the custody of the mother and the applicant was ordered to pay maintenance .
The applicant appealed against the decision on the child ’s maintenance and claimed that he had not fathered the child .

On DATE the Banská Bystrica Regional Court upheld the relevant part of ORG judgment . The appellate court ’s decision stated that the applicant was presumed to be the child ’s father in accordance with Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW .

On DATE the applicant requested that ORG bring proceedings on his behalf with a view to determining whether or not he had fathered the child born to his former wife . He explained that he did not consider himself to be the natural father of the child and that the issue could reliably be determined only by means of a blood test . The applicant further stated that he was ready to bear the costs of such a test .

On DATE the Banská Bystrica Regional Prosecutor ’s Office informed the applicant that it had been open to him to deny the paternity in respect of the child within DATE after the child ’s birth in accordance with Section ORG ) of LAW . The letter further stated that it had not been reliably shown that the applicant had not fathered the child . Furthermore , a blood test could not be carried out because of disagreement of the applicant ’s former wife . In those circumstances , the requirements laid down in LAW of LAW for a paternity action to be filed on the applicant ’s behalf were not met .

On DATE the applicant claimed before ORG that he had not fathered the child . He requested that a blood test be ordered with a view to determining this issue . The applicant explained that his last sexual intercourse with the child ’s mother had taken place in DATE , whereas the child had been born in DATE .

On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s claim as having been lodged out of time . The judgment stated that the applicant had failed to file the action within DATE after the child ’s birth as requested by Section ORG ) of LAW . In the judgment ORG pointed out that the applicant ’s arguments did not appear reliable as he had started contesting his paternity in respect of the child only after his former wife had left him in DATE . ORG further noted that public prosecutors had established no grounds for bringing paternity proceedings on the applicant ’s behalf pursuant to ORG ) of LAW .

The applicant appealed and alleged that his rights under Articles CARDINAL § CARDINAL and CARDINAL of the ORG had been violated as a result of the dismissal of his action and the refusal to carry out a blood test .

On DATE the ORG upheld ORG judgment of DATE . The judgment stated that the CARDINAL months’ time - limit laid down in Section ORG ) of LAW was preclusive . As a result of the applicant ’s failure to comply with it , his right to directly challenge the paternity of the child before a court had lapsed .
On DATE ORG informed the applicant that no reasons had been found for filing an extra - ordinary appeal on points of law against ORG judgment of DATE .

Pursuant to Section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of LAW ( PERSON o rodine ) , the husband of a woman who gives birth to a child during the marriage or not DATE after its dissolution shall be considered the child ’s father .
Section ORG ) provides that a husband can deny paternity before a court within DATE after he has learnt that his wife has given birth to a child .

Under LAW ) , when the time - limit for denying the paternity by the parent concerned has expired , ORG may file an action for disproof of paternity provided that the determination of the issue is justified by the interests of society .
According to the practice of the public prosecutors , an action under LAW ) of LAW can only be filed when there is reliable evidence that the mother ’s husband did not father the child .
